DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Classify patient within Massachusetts General Primary Care-Practice Based Research Network ( MGPC-PBRN ) accord patient-primary care provider ( PCP ) linkage status . - Develop breast cancer screen intervention program call Mammography FastTrack facilitate order mammogram use either PCPs ( PCP-linked patient ) practice manager ( practice-linked patient ) . - Compare impact Mammography FastTrack program mammography screen rate PCP-linked vs practice-linked patient overdue breast cancer screen . OUTLINE : This randomize , multicenter study . Mammography-eligible woman link either provider practice within Massachusetts General Primary Care Practice-Based Research Network ( MGPC-PBRN ) . Practices within MGPC-PBRN stratify accord baseline mammography screen rate ( high vs low ) practice type ( community health center v hospital-based vs community-based ) randomize 1 2 arm . - Arm I : Physicians practice manager receive e-mail alert month 1 3 informing availability mammography screen data panel primary-care patient . A hyperlink refers provider web-portal Mammography FastTrack program list eligible patient undergone mammography . The provider may click button schedule , defer ( provide reason deferral ) , provide date recent mammogram . - Arm II : Practices continue standard care . At end 12 month , electronic report bill data review electronic health record use determine completion mammogram . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 6,730 patient accrue study .
